sub_title: European Patent Attorney at Arnold & Siedsma
summary:
After having received my MSc degree in Applied Physics in 1989,  I spent some years doing research to obtain my PhD degree. I learned that I am quite interested in technology, but like to be involved in a different way. Therefore, I switched in 1996 to the field of intellectual property (IP), especially patents, which has not disappointed me since. It allows me to work over a broad range of technologies and to make the connection with business interests by protecting the important intellectual property assets resulting from technology development. I have IP experience from both working in an intellectual property law firm and working in a responsible position within the corporate intellectual property department of a large corporation focussed on developing advanced technology. 

At the moment I very much enjoy serving multiple clients on especially patent matters at the intellectual property law firm Arnold & Siedsma.

Specialties: My technical areas cover fields such as physics, mechanics, optics, measurement techniques, mechatronics, radiation sources, etc. I have gained a broad experience in prosecuting patent applications before patent offices wordwide, IP risk assessment and managing a patent portfolio in an international environment. My expertise further covers evaluating inventions and patent portfolios, formulating IP strategies in alignment with business strategy and establishing procedures for securing IP assets.

I managed the patent attorney group within the ASML Corporate Intellectual Property department. Over these years I considerably extended the size of the group, which consisted of a range of nationalities in the main office in Veldhoven and the branch offices in Wilton (CT), USA and Tokyo, Japan.

●  Securing patent portfolio quantity and quality - -
The patent attorney group managed to considerably grow the patent portfolio in a short time frame to enhance the intellectual property (IP) position of ASML vis-à-vis the competition.  I introduced cooperating teams of patent attorneys organized along technical and product lines to efficiently handle the various subportfolio’s covering all ASML products and technologies, and taking local branch office responsibilities into account. The patent attorney teams extended into larger teams with key research, development and system engineers and marketeers to discuss IP matters and to review large amounts of invention disclosures for patenting.

●  Patent right creation together with external agents - -
To handle the large work load of patent right creation I extended the base of external patent attorneys by cooperating with an increased number of international external counsel agents. I streamlined the working relationship with external counsel by introducing a system of information exchange and reporting, and laying down mutual expectations and responsibilities.

●  Processes and systems development - -
In this period the ASML Corporate Intellectual Property department has considerably grown, during which I contributed to overall processes and systems development and have been a member of the management team of the IP department. The processes and systems included the introduction of an IP right management system and digital document management system and corresponding processes.
